full_title_en: UCSF-CAPRA Score for Prostate Cancer Risk
medium_description_en: Predicts outcomes of patients post-treatment for prostate cancer.

seo.meta_description_en: The UCSF-CAPRA (Cancer of the Prostate Risk Assessment) Score predicts outcomes of patients post-treatment for prostate cancer.
seo.keywords_en: ucsf score prostate, ucsf capra, capra, capra score, capra equation, capra calculator, posttreatment prostate calc, post treatment prostate CA, post treatment prostatectomy, posttreatment outcomes prostate

how_to_use.pearls_pitfalls_en: A prognostic score for prostate cancer, incorporating both the PSA and Gleason Score, designed to be both simple but with an accuracy comparable with the best nomograms.

next_steps.advice_en:
• For very low risk patients, consider routine surveillance.
  • For low to intermediate-risk patients, consider localized treatment (surgery or radiation alone, brachytherapy with or without external-beam therapy).
  • For intermediate to high-risk patients, consider multimodal therapy (surgery with radiation, or radiation therapy with hormonal therapy).
  • For very high-risk patients (scores ≥8 points), consider either multimodal therapy OR hormonal therapy, and clinical trial enrollment.

creator_info.about_en: Matthew R. Cooperberg, MD, MPH, is an associate professor of urology and epidemiology/biostatistics at UCSF. He practices on the urologic oncology team of the UCSF Helen Diller Family Comprehensive Cancer Center, Mount Zion Medical Center and also operates at San Francisco General Hospital. Dr. Cooperberg researches primarily prostate cancer with a focus on effectiveness of emerging biomarkers on diagnosis and risk assessment, and relative benefits of treatment strategies on cost effectiveness and quality of life.
